Posts.Title: 40yr old with Lupus, Now Cancer =[ JMP287 angie27

Posts.Content: JMP287 wrote: Hi, New to C, New to Forum. Took me 3 weeks to even create a profile. I'm still in denial, and just can't grasp the thought in my head that this is really happening. When does one stop crying? I cry everywhere. More than I ever have. Supermarket, My daughters School, Washing dishes, 3am...anywhere it just spontaneously takes over. I am worn out, drained, and numb.  18 Years struggling with the unknown, Lupus. And now this.  Talk about curveballs (sigh)   My story: Bleeding from one breast, and clear leakage from the other for one year. Mammograms, Ultrasounds, Biopsy, AND MRI all negative. Therefore my doctor felt it was a normal hormonal reaction and they would just keep a close eye on me. Hmmmm...I did not like that anawer. I pushed for further investigation and did not stop till they agreed..August 21st I had a ductal excision of both. Results: Breast Cancer (oh and tons of uncomfortable sharp pains now) Diagnosed August 27th, I go to meet with my surgeon. I was so numb that I forgot to get a copy of my path report. But boy did I see it, clear as day. BC on the right, and tons of Pap's on the left.  It's almost like the Cancer was just waiting to grow....or be discovered. Wonder what would have happened if I agreed to just sit back and do nothing. smh Although it is early, there are way too many signs, risks, and family history to opt for radiation and lumpectomy. So Mast was highly recommended. My mom is a survivor....I was right by her side through her very long journey encouragining her, helping her, pushing her to fight, but somehow can't find the strength for myself.  Bi-Lateral Mast scheduled for October 5th, 2012 at 7am. Expanders will be put in.... Can anyone relate? Surgery 8/20/2012 Lumpectomy: Left, Right Dx 8/27/2012, DCIS, Stage 0 Surgery 10/4/2012 Mastectomy: Left, Right Surgery 10/4/2012 Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Surgery 10/4/2012 Lymph node removal: Right, Sentinel Surgery 10/9/2013 Lumpectomy: Left Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 40yr old with Lupus, Now Cancer =[ JMP287 angie27

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2012 07:51AM JMP287 wrote: Thank you @KRCornett. Exactly my thoughts. You are so right. My mom was right, going on this forum was a good idea. Touching base with people going through the same issues is probably one of the best support cushions ever.  3rd Grader? Awwww sweet. I have 3 Girls; 21, 18, and 10 What kind of surgery?
Posts.Title: 40yr old with Lupus, Now Cancer =[ JMP287 angie27

Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2012 12:27PM JMP287 wrote: Hi, Had my BMX with TE surgery October 5th, and am now home. Today is Thursday. After waking from recovery, OH BOY! the pain, the stiffness and tightness in my chest was unbearable. Not happy about that. A I must admit I did panic. Right now what I feel is a very tight feeling, almost like bricks tied on my chest and cant raise my arms. I also feel a shortness of breath. I did not do well with Morphine drip, so I am now on Percocet. I spent 24hrs vomitting and still have a little nausea.  I am still afraid of the long recovery but love to see and read how everyone else is handling this. The advice is great and definitely helps me. I still cant believe I did it. I can now relate to all of you, you are all superheroes in my book!
Posts.Title: BMX + TE scheduled Friday Oct 5th = NERVOUS!!!! JMP287 Chrisrenee77
